reporting-org.narrative: Local Development and small projects support

title.narrative: Supporting outreach and communication actions of local councils

description.narrative: Helping several local councils in Western Aleppo Countryside to communicate with and to involve their communities

title.narrative: Local councils more stabilized (human resources)- strengthened and more sustainable
% of increase of community awareness of public mechanisms of complaints treatment

description.narrative: Evaluation of local community awarness of public complaints mechanisms (exictance of general policiy- procedure and response mechanisms)//Disaggreated by : By town/ area - gender - age group

title.narrative: % of increase of local community approval rate of the local councils

description.narrative: Local community approval on the local council's performance in service provision- elections- and social cohesion efforts. Based on the field surveys and interviews with local community a measurment sacle was designed from 1-5 to measure the community approval rate. //Disaggreated by : By town/ area - gender - age group

title.narrative: % of treated complaints Vs. received complaints

description.narrative: Complaints treated by the LCs. PCs occording to the developed relevant policies. Vs. complaints received from the local community based on the presented/ implemented complaint policies by the LCs. PCs. Baseline: community feedback Semi-annual monitoring: Community feedback + LCs feedback //Disaggreated by : By Town/area

title.narrative: % of increase of local CSOs evaluation rate of the local councils

description.narrative: CSOs evaluation rate of local councils' in terms of (approval- representativeness- performance and transparency)//Disaggreated by : By Town/area - CSO

title.narrative: Communication actions by the local councils towards the local community are implemented

description.narrative: Initiatives that aim at encouraging/ supporting more/better communication/ outreach actions between the local councils and the local community in the concerned areas. //Disaggreated by : By town/ area

Local Councils- supported by the Consortium- that are organizing and implmenting communication and outreach actions towards the local community such as public meetings- community campaigns- live broadcast on media- women and IDPs meetings- sector meetings- etc.) these meetings must be publicly pre-announced by the council itself. //Disaggreated by : By town/ area

title.narrative: NB of community members attending the meetings (only for Public meetings)

description.narrative: local community memebers that are attending public meeting organized by the concerned local coumcils //Disaggreated by : By town area - age group - gender IDPS

title.narrative: Communication actions by the local councils towards the local CSOs are implemented

description.narrative: CSOs attending meetings organized by Local Councils in the concerned areas aiming at increasing local communication between LCs- PCs- and CSOs. (same CSO attending 5 meetings will be considered 5 CSOs)//Disaggreated by : By town/ area - Participant
Local Councils- supported by the Consortium- that are establishing communication and outreach actions towards the local CSOs//Disaggreated by : By town/ area

Unitiatives that aim at encouraging/ supporting more/better communication/ outreach actions between the local councils and the local community in the concerned areas. //Disaggreated by : By town/ area

title.narrative: Public complaints policies are followed in local councils

description.narrative: Local Councils in the concerned areas that develop / implment public complaints policies with the support of the Consortium. The loicies must be clearly and publicly declared with clear and known response mechanisms and procedures. Poilcies must be written in ordered to be counted //Disaggreated by : By town/ area
Public debates funded by The Consortium (10 WA 5 EG nb of local councils) //Disaggreated by : By Province
local councils that organize/ participate in public debates //Disaggreated by : By Province
